proposed_definition: A nitrogen compound respiration process in which nitrite (NO₂⁻) is oxidized to nitrate (NO₃⁻), typically coupled to oxygen reduction for energy conservation, as performed by nitrite-oxidizing bacteria and archaea.
reasoning: This definition follows the genus-differentia form starting with the parent class 'nitrogen compound respiration'. It distinguishes nitrite oxidation from other nitrogen metabolism processes by specifying: (1) the substrate (NO₂⁻), (2) the product (NO₃⁻), (3) the coupling to oxygen reduction for energy, and (4) the organism types (nitrite-oxidizing bacteria/archaea). This is the second step of nitrification and is distinct from ammonia oxidation and denitrification.
